intro: Sauvagesia elata, commonly known as the tall sauvagesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its branched, woody structure. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
